marginalia.anchor_text: Cor coeli gloriam, magistratus, famam, honores, matrem, Decima, artem, industriam, filios, & filias

position.marginalia_text: Nota diuersas significationes Decima[e] domus et Cordis Ca[e]li

marginalia.translation: Note the different indicators of the ten houses and midheaven.

position.marginalia_text: Significatores secu[n]dum substantiam et naturam propria[m] haru[m] rerum qua[e] hic citantur, hij planeta[e] et ha[e] domus existunt, alij autem Domini locoru[m] in quibus haec reperiuntur, dicunt[u]r domini secundu[m] accidens, et singulis revolutionib[us] muta[n]tur vocantur etiam dispositores, huiusmodi Domini, et significatores reru[m] et eventuu[m] futuroru[m]. Hij tame[n] planeta[e] alias res proprie significant, sicut et Domus ip[s]e, et etia[m] signa habent sua[m] propria[m] and co[n]sta[n]tem in natura significatione[m]; sed significata talia co[m]modius vnu[m]q[uod]que in peculiari capite, enumerari debent vt infra vides, capitibus 10. 12. 15. 18 [etc] vide plura folio. 84.v. et 95 r. v. [etc].

marginalia.translation: The signifiers according to their particular substance and nature of these things which are cited here, these planets and houses appear, but other lords of the places into which these are found, are called the lords according to circumstance, and are mutated by individual revolutions, [and] are also called disposers, of this kind of lords, and signifiers of future matters and events. Nevertheless these these planets indvidually signify other matters, like even the house itself, and even signs have their particular and constant signification in nature; but such significations, conveniently all, ought to be enumerated in a particular chapter, as you can see below, in the chapters 10, 12, 15, 18, et cetera. See more, folio 84 verso and 95 recto and verso, et cetera.

position.marginalia_text: Duplex eiu[s] est promissor vt in proxima pagina licet videre.

marginalia.translation: The twofold [nature] of the promissor, as one may see on the next page.
